title: Pin 31 and deepsleep on nRF51822 mKIT
body:
Two changes were made for this pull request. Both lines were already in the original code but commented out.
1. Enable the use of pin 31. 
2. Calling deepsleep() will power off the microcontroller.

title: STM32F7 HardFP Support
body:
I think STM32F746 Discovery board supports HARD FP. 
However the mbed library uses only softfp. 
I think to best use the capabilities of the board, HardFP should be supported.

title: Remove byte sent at 9600 baud on init on NRF51-DK
body:
Remove the dummy byte sent on init and instead keep track of if the
the TX line is idle.  This fixes the junk data seen on the serial port
when it is initialized.

The code to send a dummy byte was added in the following commit:
91a77d74cf70c2d8fb5b9d1ce186db44dcb0e4ba

title: Issue #666  LPC1768 i2c_slave_read fix
body:
LPC1768 slave issues a STOP condition without waiting for master #666: https://developer.mbed.org/forum/bugs-suggestions/topic/5266/

Fix credits to Ravi Bamidi.

title: Fix glitch when initializing NRF51-DK serial port
body:
When initializing the NRF51's serial TX and RTS pins set the
data output register to high before setting the setting them to
output.  This prevents these pins from glitching low before
the UART has been turned on.

title: Separating build and test results in upload script
body: This separates the build and test results when uploading them to the test database. This will provide more explicit data when showing results.

title: [B96B_F446VE] New platform + development of dma_asynch_serial + hwControlFlow
body:
B96B F446VE is a new STM32 platform.
Asynch serial has been implemented using mbed interface (using DEVICE_SERIAL_ASYNCH). 
A new define was added : DEVICE_SERIAL_ASYNCH_DMA 1 to force the use of DMA transfer for the async serial. define it to 0 if you want to use interrupts only instead of DMA.
Serial asynch can be extended to every STM32F4 family.

Serial HW Control Flow is supported for this platform (using DEVICE_SERIAL_FC define)

title: release platform MOTE_L152RC to public
body: This platform is available (stocked) on digikey as SX1272LM1CEP-ND, developer.mbed.org/platforms/NAMote-72/

body: @bcostm please test

title: Nucleo L152RE not waking from Deep Sleep
body: L152RE will wake from Sleep but not Deep Sleep I'm sure this was working a few months ago the last time I tried.

title: LPC1768 Repeated Timer::read_ms() discontinuity in returned value
Exporters - use progen to generate projects
body:
We currently use custom jinja2 templates and own python scripts (Exporters and it's children) to generate projects files.

I would like us to switch to progen to do the heavy work, simplify adding new tools. I am currently finalizing v0.8 (https://github.com/project-generator/project_generator/tree/dev_v0.8), which could be the one to enable all this development. As this version provides improvements, fixed to be able to generate a project with mbed workspace scripts. 

For a start, I already have a branch with development (https://github.com/0xc0170/mbed/tree/dev_progen), where uvision and iar are ported to use progen. 
Project generator definitions contain small subset of mbed targets, therefore we will need to add more mcu and targets there (repository here: https://github.com/project-generator/project_generator_definitions/tree/dev_v1). There's a script which can get the definition from a project file.

Anyone willing to help? I gladly assist. This requires some time to port all those targets, plus testing.

title: [RTOS] Added idle hook API
body: Added a new API for attaching an idle hook to be executed by the idle task. This will allow developers to add custom logic to the idle task (e.g. to call `sleep()`) without modifying the library code.

title: Adding BLE library
body:
Adding BLE library archives for supported toolchains.
Added missing register definition.

title: [DISCO_F746NG] Add support of this target in RTOS config files
Added Atmel Studio project exporter for Atmel targets
Teensy3.1 - K20D50M Update i2c_api.c
body:
The increase of the Teensy3.1 core clock to 96MHz has caused the i2c communication to fail.
Problem is caused by a workaround using core _NOP clock cycles to perform a delay in the i2c.stop function.
Clearly running at a higher core clock rate the delay is reduced resulting with the i2c.stop function exiting before completing.
Increasing the _NOP count to 110 does get round the issue, however this will lead to an unnecessary delay for the slower K20D50M Target that requires 60 to work, unless conditional code is employed.

Replacing the workaround code to test with I2C_S_BUSY_MASK has fixed the issue.
This now makes the function independent of the core clock frequency allowing the clock set up to be changed without affecting the i2c.stop operation.

Hardware tested on both Targets with several i2c devices.

I have also tested with KLxx range of platforms and is working there as well and should also work with the K22F and K64F Targets, although the code will be slightly different there.

title: [FATFileSystem] Disabled flush on new sector
body: Disabled "flush on new sector" by default for a ~2.87x write performance improvement.

title: [FATFileSystem] Fixed API integer widths
body: Several integer widths in the public API were incorrect, and have been modified to match the underlying FatFs library.

title: [DISCO_F746] adding gcc_arm to build_release.py
MBED Version 110 Does not have the GCC Toolchain changes submitted by ohagendorf as per PR1438
body:
MBED Version 110 Does not have the GCC Toolchain changes submitted by ohagendorf as per PR1438. 
Please merge it to the release. I understand from Martin Kojtal's reply on MBED group that build_release.py needs to be modified for this.

title: MKL25Z USB0->ISTAT bits cleared inadvertantly
body:
in [this file](https://github.com/mbedmicro/mbed/blob/master/libraries/USBDevice/USBDevice/USBHAL_KL25Z.cpp#L486) some of the USB0->ISTAT bits are being cleared by using:

USB0->ISTAT |= USB_ISTAT_STALL_MASK 

or similar.
Since these bits are 'set to clear' the code is functionally identical to clearing alls set bits or 

USB0->ISTAT = 0xFF

resulting in an ISTAT register with all the bits cleared. This will result in ignored events in the rare case that they occur while the `void USBHAL::usbisr(void)` is being executed.

I am not an expert on the order in which USB interrupts could plausibly come but I assume for example that if I were stalled by the host and then around line 476 I got reset by the host I would not want the reset flag to be cleared on line 486 and therefore lost forever.

title: Hacked up support for AN10866 USB secondary loader
body:
It looks like a bunch of people are trying to get mbed compiled code running on a bare metal mbed using the [AN10886](http://www.nxp.com/documents/application_note/AN10866.pdf) Secondary USB Bootloader.

Some aspects to make this work using the mbed build system already have been fixed (like [this](https://developer.mbed.org/questions/3022/MBED-code-fails-to-run-when-compiled-in-/))

But there are still some little tweaks to be made to make this work without hacking around.

I have mostly followed these instructions:
https://developer.mbed.org/users/hammerli22/notebook/crouching-landtiger-hidden-mbed/

I am still running into an issue when setting the NO_CRP predefine which I fixed by commenting the whole thing out. Any suggestions on what would be a more appropriate workaround?

Since the LPC1768 is so popular, would it make sense to create a bare metal LPC1768 target?

title: Adding vendor property to reports
body: Adding vendor property to reports so the testing database can handle new platforms as they get added

title: Dev xxxx xxx fix #1403
[NUCLEO_F303K8] add missing pins for arduino nano connector
LPC11U35 Compiler/linker issue
body: Some of my previously working LPC11U35 programs are hard faulting before they even get to `main()`, even known-good versions with older libraries. In an isolated test, I was able to produce an even weirder problem in which the presence of a destructor in a class breaks USBDevice, while removing it "fixes" it. I think this may be a compiler/linker issue, and that it may affect other targets as well. More details here: https://developer.mbed.org/forum/bugs-suggestions/topic/17204/

title: Adding NRF51 targets to RTC test exclude list
body:
Since the NRF51 doesn't have and RTC, it should be excluded from the automated RTC test.

This PR adds all NRF51 based targets to the RTC test's "exclude_mcu" list.

title: InterrupIn - attach with null clears the function pointer
body:
If we attach a function, then detach, a function pointer keeps pointing to an old function.

Fixes #1440

title: handle UART RX overrun on stm32l1xx
body: UART RX overrun is causing interrupt flood in uart_irq() on ST platforms. This pull request adds overrun flag clearing in the uart interrupt to prevent lockup from interrupt flooding.  The test program is here https://developer.mbed.org/users/dudmuck/code/uart_overrun_test/   I have seen lockup on NUCLEO_L152RE and _F103RB boards, but not on NXP11U68.   For now I am only concerned with stm32l1xx platform.

body: This fixes an issue where skipped builds were being uploaded to the test database.

body: Could you pls. align the implementation of `InterruptIn` to how it is done in mbedOS now?!?

title: Added exclude_mcu key to tests.py config
body:
This allows targets to be excluded from automated tests.

For example, the NRF51 does not have a RTC. This will allow the RTC test to run by default except on the NRF51 targets.

title: Support for STM32F7-Disco with GNU tools for ARM Embeeded processors
body: In the current release of mbed sdk, the mbed library is only available to use with Keil compiler for STM32F7-Disco board and no corresponding library available to use with GNU ARM tools.  When can I expect to have mbed library available with GNU ARM tools.  Please consider this request at highest priority.  Also I would like to have the library built with 'hard' floating point instead of 'softfp'.

title: Enable ADC A-channels in K22F and K64F
body:
In Kinetis chips some ADC channels have both A and B channels available.
This commit enables both of them. Previously only B-channels were available for use.

Added also some missing ADC channels to PinMap table.

Pull request solves the first issue of this question: https://developer.mbed.org/questions/58514/mbed-cant-handle-all-ADC-pins-in-Freesca/

Tested the functionality with following code using FRDM K22F

```
AnalogIn adc0_se15(PTC1); //SW button
AnalogIn adc1_se4a(PTE1);
AnalogIn adc0_se7b(PTD6);
while (1)
{
    Thread::wait(1000);
    printf("readings: PTC1: 0x%x, PTE1: 0x%x, PTD6: 0x%x\n",
                    adc0_se15.read_u16(),
                    adc1_se4a.read_u16(),
                    adc0_se7b.read_u16());
}
```

The output is as following:

```
readings: PTC1: 0xfe75, PTE1: 0xffea, PTD6: 0xeff3
```

... Button pressed

```
readings: PTC1: 0x0, PTE1: 0xffec, PTD6: 0x8d1f
```

... PTE1 pulled down externally

```
readings: PTC1: 0xfe70, PTE1: 0xf, PTD6: 0xeff0
```

... PTD6 pulled down externally

```
readings: PTC1: 0xfe3e, PTE1: 0xffeb, PTD6: 0x0
```

title: Enhance stream
[TARGET_STMF0] Fix #1419 baudrateissue
body:
Issue was: stdio printf is ok, serial.printf is failing in case it is initialized as a global variable. But it works on mbed version 107.
Fix: revert to version 107 for systemxx.c, mbed_overrides.c + cmsis_nvic.c
Modify cmsis_nvic.c to use direct addressing instead of a pointer (this pointer is not yet initialized when called from systemxx.c, thus can crash the platform).
Call HAL_Init in mbed_overrides.c for every platforms.

title: Fixes issue where library is compiled multiple times during testing
body:
There was in issue this commit: https://github.com/mbedmicro/mbed/commit/065705009828b7c1255797f7d628de1cbedc9bb4

It will try to build libraries for the tests (eg RTOS, RTX, et) multiple times. This fixes that issue.

title: Bugfixes to EFM32 serial, spi and sleep HAL
body:
This PR fixes a few bugs in the serial, spi and sleep HAL implementations for EFM32.
- serial: set TXC interrupt flag on the correct peripheral when performing async write using interrupts
- spi: remove erroneous `sleep()` call in `spi_master_write()`, declare init helper functions as static
- sleep: remove option to enter EM4, as there is no way of configuring wakeup from EM4 in mbed

@0xc0170

title: Add option to build.py for building rpc library
body: The python build script has options for building usb, rtos, etc, but I don't see an option for rpc.  I'd be glad to submit a PR to add this if you'd like.

title: Fix for issue with libraries being built out of order
body:
I introduced a regression a while ago that builds library dependencies out of order when building tests. This PR fixes that regression.

Library dependencies are now built in the order they are specified in the test's definition in tests.py.

Ex. for the test `NET_1`, its definition looks like this in tests.py:

```
    {
        "id": "NET_1", "description": "TCP client hello world",
        "source_dir": join(TEST_DIR, "net", "helloworld", "tcpclient"),
        "dependencies": [MBED_LIBRARIES, RTOS_LIBRARIES, ETH_LIBRARY, TEST_MBED_LIB],
        "duration": 15,
        "automated": True,
        "peripherals": ["ethernet"],
    },
```

You can see the order in which the library dependencies will be built by examining the `dependencies` key.

title: Added new Nucleo target - F410RB
Consolidate Reporting and add Build Reports
body:
This is a big PR! It's hard one to split up because there are so many dependent parts.
- Attempts to consolidate most reports across all scripts. The same data structure is used for Junit reports and printed reports (for builds especially).
- Adds Junit reports for builds. This will help with keeping track of builds in CI.
- Now prints which tests and libraries succeeded or failed to build in the build summary (for build_release.py and singletest.py)

I have done quite a bit of testing with this locally and this does not seem to break any of our existing scripts. The changes are mostly behind-the-scenes with a few added features.

title: default serial baud rate is incorrect on Nucleo-F070RB platform
body:
The default baud rate for Serial is documented as being 9600, but when the Nucleo_printf example is built for the Nucleo-F070RB platform using mbed revision 109, the actual baud rate is 57600.  It appears that this was broken by commit d571b16e907bd404dc5bbba7ae18ad79d5899b75.  Reviewing the commit, I suspect that this problem exists for all STMF0 platforms.  More debugging details can be found here: https://developer.mbed.org/questions/61404/baud-rate-problem-on-Nucleo-F070RB-platf/#answer8910.

FYI, I have also noticed that the default SPI bus clock frequency on the Nucleo-F070RB platform is 1.5 MHz rather than the documented 1 MHz default.  I haven't attempted to track down the source of this problem.

galen

title: DISCO-L476VG Pinmap error: wrong port number
Added Nucleo F410RB target
Handling failures correctly and adding timeout status
body:
- Instead reporting any result that's not OK as a FAIL, it will keep the error message (TIMEOUT, FAIL, ERROR, etc)
- Fixes this issue in the upload result script as well

title: Added support for SAML21
body: Most of the changes are pertaining to splitting folders into TARGET_SAMD21, TARGET_SAML21 and TARGET_SAMR21. Very minimal changes with respect to supporting SAML21.

title: deleting PwmOut object crashes application
SystemCoreClock and USB clock settings dependency (STM32 series)
body:
In case you want to use the USB device (or host) features the core clockspeed has to have certain values otherwise you can not get the correct USB clock of 48 MHz. On the F103 for example you can run at 72 MHz core speed with 8MHz external clocks (PLL: 8x9 = 72, USB: 72/1.5=48), but you can only get a maximum of 48 MHz core speed using the 8 MHz HSI (PLL: (8/2)x12 = 48, USB: 48/1=48). 
It would be nice to include #define settings for USB in system_stm32fxxx.c. It would be even better when these selections can be set without importing and modifying the mbed lib source.

See also discussion on issue #1096 regarding timeout for clock auto-select.

title: Renamed TARGET_SAM_CortexM0+ to TARGET_SAM_CortexM0P for compatiblity with online compiler
body: No files has been modified in this PR. Just TARGET_SAM_CortexM0+ folder is renamed to TARGET_SAM_CortexM0P.

title: Fix broken STM32_NUCLEO_L152RE UARTs 4 and 5.
body: Fixes issue #1405. USART4_BASE and USART5_BASE are changed to UART4_BASE and UART5_BASE in libraries/mbed/targets/hal/TARGET_STM/TARGET_STM32L1/serial_api.c.

title: UARTs 4 and 5 on STM32 NUCLEOL152RE do not work
Modify to not missed the received data in EthernetInterface
body:
Hi,

We added the measures so as not to miss the received data In EthernetInterface.

Regards,
Yamanaka

title: STM platform RTC reset issue
body:
Could we finally have a fix for the RTC reset issue.
Most of the STM's have a RTC-ISR register that can be checked if the RTC is running.

A simple check in the RTC_API.c does work, I have been using it for some time now:

if(RTC->ISR == 7) {     // RTC initialization and status register (RTC_ISR), cold start (with no backup domain power) RTC reset value 

Bypass the RTC initialise in this case that stops the register being reset.

I believe Martin did merge a PR from me a few weeks back for the F7 but that seems not to have happened.

title: Fix analogin checking the wrong flag for completion
body: According to the Reference Manual v3, section 31.1.5 Usage, "When the ADC conversion is completed, an END event will be generated..." therefore the END event should be polled instead of the BUSY reg. There are cases where the BUSY flag is deasserted before the result of the conversion has been stored into the RESULT reg.

title: mbed_debug debug() and debug_if() functions aren't weak
[STM32F4xx] Remove eventual pending stop bit before start on I2C
Test
body:
Sorry.

Test request.

title: [NUCLEO_F042K6] HSI default value rightly set
body: this resolves a lot of problems and the external clock can be check

title: [NUCLEO_F031K6] Add HSI calibration default value
body:
Fix issue with MBED_A9 and EXAMPLE_1 tests.

Sorry for all the other commits, I am not able to remove them. Even with a rebase.

title: [NUCLEO_F042K6] remove external clock
Added Keil compiler support for Atmel Targets
Fix #1393 - I2C assumes NRF_TWI1
body: Without this fix SPI locks up if it is using the second I2C/SPI peripheral after I2C has been initialised (evne if I2C uses the first peripheral).

title: nRF51822 I2C code always assumes you are using NRF_TWI1 - locks up if not!!
body:
The nRF51822 has two I2C/SPI peripherals. Each can be used for I2C _or_ SPI, but not both.

The code in `i2c_api.c` and `spi_api.c` uses a first-come-first-served principle, and keeps track of which peripheral is being used for what. This is great. That's how it should be.

Unfortunately it makes calls to functions in `twi_master.c` that are _hard-coded_ to use `NRF_TWI1`. If you happen to have code that initialises SPI first (giving it the second peripheral for some reason), and then I2C, the I2C will get `NRF_TWI0`. It will then fiddle around with NRF_TWI1 (the second I2C/SPI peripheral) which will then cause SPI to lock up when you use it.

It honestly seems like someone just forgot to finish writing the code!

I've written some code which seems to fix this, but I haven't looked into how all the PPI stuff interacts with it so I'm not 100% sure. It is definitely an improvement though and fixes my specific use.

title: [DISCO_F469NI] add disco F469NI support
[Nucleo f042] some minor issues
body:
adding missing coide project template for exporter
adding STM32F042K6 to rtos lib
- rtos tests fail because of memory footprint of printf e.g. basic rtos test without printf is OK
- basic rtos functions are OK and some small rtos programs might be possible

title: [HAL][K20XX] us_ticker changes
body:
Fixed for the K20D50M a possible race condition in the software part of
the timer.
The Teensy has the ability to chain timers, so similar to the KSDK ones
we switched it to full hardware timers for both Ticker and regular
Timer.

I probably should have finished typing the commit name :).

title: Redundant flags in Makefile templates
body:
It looks that compilation is ok without having to declare twice :
`$(LIBRARIES) $(LD_SYS_LIBS)`

title: Copy NVIC to RAM from anywhere in flash for TARGET_K22F
body:
This is the same as [ebcee71](https://github.com/mbedmicro/mbed/commit/061cb8729442dc31a2676d3bd3aaa20c7ebcee71) applied to TARGET_K22F.  This lets the NVIC be relocated from addresses other than 0x0.

Tested on a FRDM-K22F with the default test suite and GCC_ARM.

title: Change optimization options of RZ_A1H.
body:
Hi,

We have changed the optimization options of RZ_A1H to "Ospace" regardless of the compiler version.

Regards,
Yamanaka

title: mbed error compiling with option: TIM_SLAVEMODE_COMBINED_RESETTRIGGER
body:
no problem with other option (TIM_SLAVEMODE_EXTERNAL1, TIM_SLAVEMODE_GATED etc...)

platform STM32F4 401RE
    TIM_SlaveConfigTypeDef SlaveConfig;
    SlaveConfig.SlaveMode = TIM_SLAVEMODE_COMBINED_RESETTRIGGER;
    SlaveConfig.InputTrigger = TIM_TS_TI1F_ED;
    HAL_TIM_SlaveConfigSynchronization(&timer, &SlaveConfig);

error when compiling:
Error: Identifier "TIM_SLAVEMODE_COMBINED_RESETTRIGGER" is undefined in "counter.cpp", Line: 70, Col: 30

rmbed library: 
https://github.com/mbedmicro/mbed/blob/9b7d23d47153c298a6d24de9a415202705889d11/libraries/mbed/targets/cmsis/TARGET_STM/TARGET_STM32L4/stm32l4xx_hal_tim.h
# define TIM_SLAVEMODE_DISABLE                ((uint32_t)0x0000)
# define TIM_SLAVEMODE_RESET                  ((uint32_t)(TIM_SMCR_SMS_2))
# define TIM_SLAVEMODE_GATED                  ((uint32_t)(TIM_SMCR_SMS_2 | TIM_SMCR_SMS_0))
# define TIM_SLAVEMODE_TRIGGER                ((uint32_t)(TIM_SMCR_SMS_2 | TIM_SMCR_SMS_1))
# define TIM_SLAVEMODE_EXTERNAL1              ((uint32_t)(TIM_SMCR_SMS_2 | TIM_SMCR_SMS_1 | TIM_SMCR_SMS_0))
# define TIM_SLAVEMODE_COMBINED_RESETTRIGGER  ((uint32_t)(TIM_SMCR_SMS_3))

missing option for STM32 F4 ?

title: targets.py: NRF51: support S110 builds for OTA and BOOT targets
body:
Current S110 support is only available for default (SoftDevice + App)
images.
At the moment, a BOOT image built for micro:bit will contain the S130
SoftDevice and the app will be located at 0x1c000, even though we want a
S110 SoftDevice.
Since the elf build is still done with the S110 linker script, the entry
point will be offsetted by 0x2000 and it will fail to run.

This patch creates an interface class that allows all S110 targets to
override the SoftDevices list.

Signed-off-by: Jean-Philippe Brucker jean-philippe.brucker@arm.com

---

Changes since v1:
- Also move the TARGET_MCU_NRF51_16K_S110 label into the common interface

title: [STM32xx] Fix analog_out issue with 12 to 16bits conversion
body: Issue #1383

title: bug in analogout_write_u16() for nucleo F446RE
body:
My DAC test program worked on LPC1768 and K64F but not on F446RE.  DAC write() API says value is 16 bits, and the working platforms shift the value to the proper DAC resolution, but in
mbed/libraries/mbed/targets/hal/TARGET_STM/TARGET_STM32F4/analogout_api.c
the DAC value is clipped instead of shifted

The same problem looks to be in
targets/hal/TARGET_STM/TARGET_STM32F7/analogout_api.c
targets/hal/TARGET_STM/TARGET_STM32F3XX/analogout_api.c

Also, analogout_read_u16() in  those .c files also aren't shifting the read value into a 16-bit value ...

title: Travis config - Migrate from legacy to container-based infrastructure
body: As subject, port this to a new container based infrastructure. This message is shown for our last builds.

title: In USB Host, fix bugs of device insertion and removal and isochronous transfer.
body:
Hi,

We modified bugs of device insertion and removal and isochronous transfer.

Bugs are as below.
- When user disconnect the USB during Audio playback, GR-PEACH may not recognize it.
- When running isochronous transfer multiple at the same time, GR-PEACH can not operate properly.

Regards,
Yamanaka

title: add support for printing and scanning floats for MultiTech platforms
